title: Keto Egg Roll in a Bowl
description: A deconstructed egg roll that captures the savory, garlicky pork and crisp cabbage flavors without the wrapper. Quick-stir fry method yields tender ground pork, crunchy cabbage, and a bright sesame-ginger finish — perfect for a low-carb weeknight meal.

ingredients.notes: adds crunch; can use all napa if preferred

ingredients.display_name: carrot, julienned (optional for color, small amount)
ingredients.notes: omit for stricter keto or whole30 if desired

ingredients.display_name: green onions, sliced (white and green separated)
ingredients.notes: separate whites for cooking and greens for garnish

ingredients.display_name: avocado oil (or neutral oil for frying)
tamari or soy sauce (use tamari for gluten-free)
ingredients.notes: or coconut aminos to keep soy-free
adjust to taste, consider salt in tamari

steps.text: Prep all produce: thinly slice napa and green cabbage, julienne carrot if using, mince garlic, grate ginger, and slice green onions separating whites and greens.
Heat a large wide skillet or wok over medium-high heat until hot, then add avocado oil and swirl to coat.

Add ground pork to the hot pan and break into small pieces with a spatula; cook without stirring for 1-2 minutes to develop browning, then continue to brown until no longer pink (about 4 minutes total).
Push the pork to one side of the skillet; add the beaten eggs to the empty space, scramble quickly until just set, then mix eggs into the pork.
Add the white parts of the green onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger to the pan; sauté for about 30-45 seconds until fragrant.

Add both cabbages and carrot to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook, stirring occasionally, until cabbage is wilted but still has some crunch (about 4-5 minutes). If pan looks dry, add 1-2 tablespoons water to help steam and prevent burning.
Stir in tamari (or soy sauce/coconut aminos), rice vinegar, red pepper flakes if using, salt and pepper; toss to evenly coat and cook for another 1-2 minutes to meld flavors.
Turn off heat and drizzle sesame oil over the mixture, toss in green onion tops and adjust seasoning to taste. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds if desired and serve immediately.
